subject: p14556809
History: Assessment of chest tube, pneumonia, chronic heart failure.
Findings: As compared to the previous radiograph, the patient has been intubated. The tip of the endotracheal tube projects 3 cm above the carina. A left pectoral pacemaker is in unchanged position. In the interval, lung volumes have substantially decreased, there are signs indicative of mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema and atelectasis at both lung bases. No evidence of pneumonia. Short-term followup with chest radiographs is required.
